seitinemA";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-12-30 10:50:11";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-12-30 Property Rights Seminar on Branding and Innovation - Signing Ceremony for Memorandum of Cooperation";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-01-14";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"1";s:7:"content";s:9670:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>The coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic has caused trade disruptions; a drop in foreign direct investment; and scarring effects on poverty, education, and women in many nations. However, it has also beneficial features. Asia has continued to produce and export during the pandemic. COVID-19 has boosted digitalisation, notably in information and communication technology (ICT). The adoption of ICT has boosted economic growth. As drastic transformation of business models due to such digitalisation, it is expected that distinguished businesses like e-commerce will be or are appearing.</p>
<p>Considering these social backgrounds, a branding strategy by utilizing IPR such as trademarks and designs is also crucial, so as to distinguish excellent goods and businesses from others appropriately. it will connect them to investment and industrial development in the country.</p>
<p>In this context, IPR including trademarks, and designs is a key to producing innovative and distinguished businesses from Cambodia.</p>
<p>Under the circumstance, MoC, JPO and ERIA have reached an understanding to need to strengthen technical cooperation on research in the field of IPR.</p>
<p>This ceremony will be held for the purpose of confirming mutual understanding and cooperations among MoC, JPO, and ERIA.</p>
<p>Further, IPR seminar will be held to utilize this opportunity of MOCs among MoC, MISTI, JPO, and ERIA for the purpose of enhancing the awareness of IPR in Cambodia.</p>
<h2 data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Event Details</span></h2>
<p data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Date: Tuesday, 24 January 2022<br />Time: 9 AM to 11:15 AM (Jakarta time, UTC+7)<br /></span></p>
<p><input id="ext" type="hidden" /><input id="ext" type="hidden" /></p>
<p><input id="ext" type="hidden" /><input id="ext" type="hidden" /></p>
<p><input id="ext" type="hidden" /><input id="ext" type="hidden" /></p>
</body>
</html>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Hybrid event";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-01-24";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:3741:"Intellectual Property Rights Seminar on Branding and Innovation - Signing Ceremony for Memorandum of Cooperation Intellectual Property Rights Seminar on Branding and Innovation - Signing Ceremony for Memorandum of Cooperation The coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic has caused trade disruptions; a drop in foreign direct investment; and scarring effects on poverty, education, and women in many nations. However, it has also beneficial features. Asia has continued to produce and export during the pandemic. COVID-19 has boosted digitalisation, notably in information and communication technology (ICT). The adoption of ICT has boosted economic growth. As drastic transformation of business models due to such digitalisation, it is expected that distinguished businesses like e-commerce will be or are appearing.
Considering these social backgrounds, a branding strategy by utilizing IPR such as trademarks and designs is also crucial, so as to distinguish excellent goods and businesses from others appropriately. it will connect them to investment and industrial development in the country.
In this context, IPR including trademarks, and designs is a key to producing innovative and distinguished businesses from Cambodia.
Under the circumstance, MoC, JPO and ERIA have reached an understanding to need to strengthen technical cooperation on research in the field of IPR.
This ceremony will be held for the purpose of confirming mutual understanding and cooperations among MoC, JPO, and ERIA.
Further, IPR seminar will be held to utilize this opportunity of MOCs among MoC, MISTI, JPO, and ERIA for the purpose of enhancing the awareness of IPR in Cambodia.
Event Details

.aidobmaC ni RPI fo ssenerawa eht gnicnahne fo esoprup eht rof AIRE dna ,OPJ ,ITSIM ,CoM gnoma sCOM fo ytinutroppo siht ezilitu ot dleh eb lliw ranimes RPI ,rehtruF
.AIRE dna ,OPJ ,CoM gnoma snoitarepooc dna gnidnatsrednu lautum gnimrifnoc fo esoprup eht rof dleh eb lliw ynomerec sihT
.RPI fo dleif eht ni hcraeser no noitarepooc lacinhcet nehtgnerts ot deen ot gnidnatsrednu na dehcaer evah AIRE dna OPJ ,CoM ,ecnatsmucric eht rednU
.aidobmaC morf sessenisub dehsiugnitsid dna evitavonni gnicudorp ot yek a si sngised dna ,skramedart gnidulcni RPI ,txetnoc siht nI
.yrtnuoc eht ni tnempoleved lairtsudni dna tnemtsevni ot meht tcennoc lliw ti .yletairporppa srehto morf sessenisub dna sdoog tnellecxe hsiugnitsid ot sa os ,laicurc osla si sngised dna skramedart sa hcus RPI gnizilitu yb ygetarts gnidnarb a ,sdnuorgkcab laicos eseht gniredisnoC

gniteeM maeT ydutS ts1";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-11-28 13:10:20";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-11-28 13:10:20";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:21:"siti.diyanah@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:19;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7206";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:136:"eria-iges-aprscp-hybrid-event-the-implementation-of-extended-producer-responsibility-in-the-asian-context-challenges-and-lessons-learned";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:146:"ERIA-IGES-APRSCP Hybrid Event: â€˜The Implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility in the Asian Context: Challenges and Lessons Learned'";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-11-23";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:4186:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/EPR%20Flyer%20Webinar.png" alt="" width="621" height="621" /></p><p>Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) is an environmental policy approach that extends a producer&rsquo;s responsibility for a product to the post-consumer stage of the product&rsquo;s life cycle. To respond to the increasing amount of post-consumer waste, including plastics, a number of countries have started introducing this &ldquo;polluter pays principle&rdquo; as their policy instrument. In Asia, some countries have implemented the EPR systems, some with a longer experience that dated back in 1995.</p><p>To introduce the key concepts and objectives of EPR for plastic waste reduction in the Asian context, as well as to discuss the main challenges and key takeaways of the system, the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris of ERIA, along with the Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES) and the Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP) organize a hybrid event entitled &lsquo;The Implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility in the Asian Context: Challenges and Lessons Learned&rsquo;. This event is part of the 16th Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP 2022: Carbon Neutral Event): &#039;Bridging Net Zero Transition by SCP and Circular Economy&#039;.</p><h2>Event Details</h2><ul><li>Date: Wednesday, 23 November 2022</li><li>Time: 9 AM - 12 PM (Bangkok Time/UTC +7)</li><li>Venue: Patthumwan Princess Hotel, Bangkok, Thailand (hybrid event)</li></ul><h2>Agenda</h2><table style="height: 263px; width: 624px;"><tr><td style="width: 144.262px;">9AM - 9:15AM&nbsp;</td><td style="width: 462.738px;"><p><strong><strong>Welcome and Opening Remarks</strong></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Dr Yasuhiko Hotta</strong>, Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP)/Programme Director, SCP Area, Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES)</li><li><strong>Mr Michikazu Kojima,</strong> Senior Advisor, Chief Senior Researcher, ERIA/IDE-JETRO</li></ul><p><strong>Photo session</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 144.262px;">9:15AM - 11:05AM</td><td style="width: 462.738px;"><p><strong>Presentations:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Mr Michikazu Kojima, </strong>Senior Advisor, Chief Senior Researcher &ndash; ERIA/IDE-JETRO -<strong> &ldquo;Overview of EPR implementation in several countries&rdquo;</strong></li><li><strong>Dr Yasuhiko </strong><strong>Hotta, </strong>Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP) -<strong> &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Japan&rdquo;<br /> </strong></li><li><strong>Mr Pranshu Singhal</strong>, Founder and Director, Karo Sambhav &ndash; <strong>&ldquo;EPR implementation in India&rdquo;</strong></li><li><strong>Ms Pauline Goh</strong>, General Manager of Malaysian Recycling Alliance Berhad (MAREA), Malaysia - <strong>&ldquo;EPR Implementation in Malaysia"</strong></li><li><strong>Panate Manomaivibool, PhD, </strong>Head of the Circular Economy for Waste-free Thailand (CEWT) Research Center, the School of Science, Mae Fah Luang University, Thailand -<strong> &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Thailand&rdquo;</strong></li><li><strong>Mr Federico Tempestilli</strong>, Circular Economy Consultant, UNDP, Cambodia - <strong>&ldquo;EPR Implementation in Cambodia&rdquo;</strong></li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 144.262px;">11:05AM - 11:50AM</td><td style="width: 462.738px;"><p><strong>Q&amp;A</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 144.262px;">11:50AM - 12PM</td><td style="width: 462.738px;"><p><strong>Closing Remark </strong></p><p><strong>Dr. Yasuhiko Hotta</strong>, Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP)/ Programme Director, SCP Area, Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES)</p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://zoom.us/j/6557725657?pwd=YnRhamUyK29nWHgzRTYxL2tqd252dz09#success" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">JOIN ZOOM!&nbsp;</a></p><p><strong>MEETING ID: </strong>655 772 5657 |&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>PASSCODE: </strong>54321</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Hybrid Event";s:5:"major";s:13:"Ms Hera Diani";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-11-23";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2022-11-23";s:8:"keywords";s:6889:"ERIA-IGES-APRSCP Hybrid Event: â€˜The Implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility in the Asian Context: Challenges and Lessons Learned' ERIA-IGES-APRSCP Hybrid Event: â€˜The Implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility in the Asian Context: Challenges and Lessons Learned' Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) is an environmental policy approach that extends a producer&rsquo;s responsibility for a product to the post-consumer stage of the product&rsquo;s life cycle. To respond to the increasing amount of post-consumer waste, including plastics, a number of countries have started introducing this &ldquo;polluter pays principle&rdquo; as their policy instrument. In Asia, some countries have implemented the EPR systems, some with a longer experience that dated back in 1995.
To introduce the key concepts and objectives of EPR for plastic waste reduction in the Asian context, as well as to discuss the main challenges and key takeaways of the system, the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris of ERIA, along with the Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES) and the Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP) organize a hybrid event entitled &lsquo;The Implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility in the Asian Context: Challenges and Lessons Learned&rsquo;. This event is part of the 16th Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP 2022: Carbon Neutral Event): 'Bridging Net Zero Transition by SCP and Circular Economy'.
Event Details

Date: Wednesday, 23 November 2022
Time: 9 AM - 12 PM (Bangkok Time/UTC +7)
Venue: Patthumwan Princess Hotel, Bangkok, Thailand (hybrid event)

Agenda



9AM - 9:15AM&nbsp;

Welcome and Opening Remarks

Dr Yasuhiko Hotta, Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP)/Programme Director, SCP Area, Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES)
Mr Michikazu Kojima, Senior Advisor, Chief Senior Researcher, ERIA/IDE-JETRO

Photo session



9:15AM - 11:05AM

Presentations:

Mr Michikazu Kojima, Senior Advisor, Chief Senior Researcher &ndash; ERIA/IDE-JETRO - &ldquo;Overview of EPR implementation in several countries&rdquo;
Dr Yasuhiko Hotta, Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP) - &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Japan&rdquo; 
Mr Pranshu Singhal, Founder and Director, Karo Sambhav &ndash; &ldquo;EPR implementation in India&rdquo;
Ms Pauline Goh, General Manager of Malaysian Recycling Alliance Berhad (MAREA), Malaysia - &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Malaysia"
Panate Manomaivibool, PhD, Head of the Circular Economy for Waste-free Thailand (CEWT) Research Center, the School of Science, Mae Fah Luang University, Thailand - &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Thailand&rdquo;
Mr Federico Tempestilli, Circular Economy Consultant, UNDP, Cambodia - &ldquo;EPR Implementation in Cambodia&rdquo;




11:05AM - 11:50AM

Q&amp;A



11:50AM - 12PM

Closing Remark 
Dr. Yasuhiko Hotta, Vice President, Asia Pacific Roundtable on Sustainable Consumption and Production (APRSCP)/ Programme Director, SCP Area, Institute for Global Environmental Strategies (IGES)

.5991 ni kcab detad taht ecneirepxe regnol a htiw emos ,smetsys RPE eht detnemelpmi evah seirtnuoc emos ,aisA nI .tnemurtsni ycilop rieht sa ;ouqdr&elpicnirp syap retullop;ouqdl& siht gnicudortni detrats evah seirtnuoc fo rebmun a ,scitsalp gnidulcni ,etsaw remusnoc-tsop fo tnuoma gnisaercni eht ot dnopser oT .elcyc efil s;ouqsr&tcudorp eht fo egats remusnoc-tsop eht ot tcudorp a rof ytilibisnopser s;ouqsr&recudorp a sdnetxe taht hcaorppa ycilop latnemnorivne na si )RPE( ytilibisnopseR recudorP dednetxE 'denraeL snosseL dna segnellahC :txetnoC naisA eht ni ytilibisnopseR recudorP dednetxE fo noitatnemelpmI ehT˜€â :tnevE dirbyH PCSRPA-SEGI-AIRE 'denraeL snosseL dna segnellahC :txetnoC naisA eht ni ytilibisnopseR recudorP dednetxE fo noitatnemelpmI ehT˜€â :tnevE dirbyH PCSRPA-SEGI-AIRE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-11-18 12:45:56";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-11-22 09:22:55";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:19:"hera.diani@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:20;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7204";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:98:"challenges-opportunities-of-indonesian-automotive-industry-development-in-the-era-of-case-and-maas";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:100:"Challenges & Opportunities of Indonesian Automotive Industry Development in the Era of CASE and MaaS";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-12";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:27648:"<p data-key="203"></p><p data-key="203"><span data-key="204">Indonesia is a large country with a population of 270 million and accounts for about half of the GDP of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). Among these, the automobile industry is the second largest production in ASEAN after Thailand, with annual sales of over 1 million vehicles. In Indonesia, a presidential decree in 2019 set out the promotion of electric vehicles (EVs), and the strengthening of automobile production, including EVs, is something that is largely positioned in the national development strategy. Currently, the Ministry of Industry of Indonesia sets a target of EV penetration, which will be 25 per cent of total vehicle sales in 2030. The government also tries to develop the EV battery Ecosystem by strengthening the battery production capacities within the country. This was also a major focus of the G20 under the Indonesian chairmanship this year. </span></p><p data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">In 2023, Indonesia will be the chair of the ASEAN Summit. The development of the country's automotive industry is an important issue not only for Indonesia but also for the regional economic development of ASEAN. In particular, as new trends surrounding the automotive, such as CASE (Connected, Autonomous, Service/Sharing, and Electrified) and MaaS (Mobility as a Service) based on digitalisation, are growing, and there is an urgent need for all sectors involved in the automotive industry to formulate strategies to take advantage of these changes as an opportunity to make a big leap forward. The aim of this workshop is to stimulate discussion by inviting people from governments, academia and industries for the further development of the Indonesian automotive industry in the CASE and MaaS era.</span></p><h2 data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Event Details</span></h2><p data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Date: Thursday, 1 December 2022<br>Time: 9 AM to 12 PM (Jakarta time, UTC+7)<br>Place: </span><span data-key="207">Meeting Room 3-4, ERIA, Sentral Senayan II, 5th Floor, Jl Asia Afrika, Jakarta (limited space)<br><br><a class="bluebtn" title="RSVP for in-person attendance via Eventbrite" href="http://bit.ly/3tCW1O6" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">RSVP for in-person attendance</a></span></p><p data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Streamed via: Zoom<br><a class="bluebtn" title="RSVP for online attendance via Eventbrite" href="https://bit.ly/3Gh7WZy" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">RSVP for online attendance</a><br></span></p><h2 data-key="206" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="207">Agenda</span></h2><p data-key="206" data-slate-fragment="">Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><table style="width: 722.047px;"><tbody><tr><td style="width: 177px;">9 AM to 9:10 AM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;"><p>Opening Remarks <br><strong>Dr Ala</strong><strong>d</strong><strong>din D. Rillo</strong>, Senior Economic Advisor, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 177px;">9 AM to 9:25 AM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;"><p>Special Remarks <br><strong>Mr Eko S. A. Cahyanto</strong>, Director General of Industrial Resilience, Regions and International Access, Ministry of Industry of Indonesia</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 177px;">9:25 AM to 9:55 AM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;"><p>Keynote Lecture<br><strong>Mr Masao Suematsu</strong>, Senior Vice President of DENSO International Asia Co., Ltd. (DIAT)</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 177px;">9:55 AM to 10:05 AM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;">Coffee Break</td></tr><tr><td style="width: 177px;">10:05 AM to 11:50 AM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;"><p>Panel Discussion</p><ul><li><strong>Prof. Seio Nakajima</strong>, Dean and Professor, Graduate School of Asia-Pacific Studies, Waseda University; Director, Research Institute of Auto Parts Industries, Waseda University, Japan</li><li><strong>Dr Yasushi Ueki</strong>, Senior Research Fellow, IDE-JETRO</li><li><strong>Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto</strong>, Energy Economist, ERIA</li><li><strong>Mr R Hendro Martono</strong>, Director of Maritime Industry, Transportation and Defence Appliances (IMATAP)</li><li><strong>Prof. Sutanto Soehodho</strong>, Professor at the Faculty of Technology, University of Indonesia</li></ul><p>Moderator: <strong>Mr Fusanori Iwasaki</strong>, Director for Policy Research, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 177px;">11:50 AM to 12 PM</td><td style="width: 550.047px;"><p>Closing Remarks<br><strong>Prof. Yasuhiro Yamada</strong>, Special Assistant to the President on Mekong Affairs, ERIA</p></td></tr></tbody></table>";s:10:"image_name";s:37:"/uploads/events/logo6396b5495ec34.png";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:29:"automotive,industry,Indonesia";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:37:"Virtual Room and ERIA office, Jakarta";s:5:"major";s:4:"7274";s:16:"article_keywords";s:29:"automotive,industry,Indonesia";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-01";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2022-12-01";s:8:"keywords";s:7021:"Challenges & Opportunities of Indonesian Automotive Industry Development in the Era of CASE and MaaS Challenges & Opportunities of Indonesian Automotive Industry Development in the Era of CASE and MaaS Indonesia is a large country with a population of 270 million and accounts for about half of the GDP of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). Among these, the automobile industry is the second largest production in ASEAN after Thailand, with annual sales of over 1 million vehicles. In Indonesia, a presidential decree in 2019 set out the promotion of electric vehicles (EVs), and the strengthening of automobile production, including EVs, is something that is largely positioned in the national development strategy. Currently, the Ministry of Industry of Indonesia sets a target of EV penetration, which will be 25 per cent of total vehicle sales in 2030. The government also tries to develop the EV battery Ecosystem by strengthening the battery production capacities within the country. This was also a major focus of the G20 under the Indonesian chairmanship this year. 
In 2023, Indonesia will be the chair of the ASEAN Summit. The development of the country's automotive industry is an important issue not only for Indonesia but also for the regional economic development of ASEAN. In particular, as new trends surrounding the automotive, such as CASE (Connected, Autonomous, Service/Sharing, and Electrified) and MaaS (Mobility as a Service) based on digitalisation, are growing, and there is an urgent need for all sectors involved in the automotive industry to formulate strategies to take advantage of these changes as an opportunity to make a big leap forward. The aim of this workshop is to stimulate discussion by inviting people from governments, academia and industries for the further development of the Indonesian automotive industry in the CASE and MaaS era.
Event Details

Cahyanto, Director General of Industrial Resilience, Regions and International Access, Ministry of Industry of Indonesia";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:21;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7203";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:54:"asia-europe-cooperation-on-inclusive-digital-societies";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:54:"Asia-Europe Cooperation on Inclusive Digital Societies";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-07";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:7436:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/Asia-Europe-cooperation-on-Inclusive-digital-societies-.png" alt="" width="800" height="500" /></p><p>On 7 December 2022, the LeidenAsiaCentre together with GLOBTAXGOV and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), organises a webinar on Asian-European cooperation in the digital sphere. The webinar will specifically focus on the building of inclusive digital societies. This means that individuals, particularly those in disadvantaged groups, have access to, and the skills to use ICT and are therefore able to participate in and benefit from the emergent digital society. In which ways can Asia and Europe cooperate in creating inclusive digital societies? What forms of cooperation between Asian and European countries already exist in the digital sphere?</p><p>This webinar follows the 13th&nbsp;Asia-Europe Meeting (ASEM) Summit, and the book &#039;<a title="Click here to read and download the book for free" href="/publications/13th-asia-europe-meeting-asem-summit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Multilateral Cooperation for a Resilient, Sustainable, and Rules-Based Future for ASEM&#039;</a>, which was a result of that summit.</p><p><strong>Date:</strong>&nbsp;Wednesday, 7 December 2022<br /><strong>Time:</strong> 9 AM - 11 AM&nbsp; Central European Time (CET) / 3 PM to 5 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="Click here to register via the Leiden Asia Centre&#039;s website" href="https://leidenasiacentre.nl/event/seminar-asia-europe-cooperation-on-inclusive-digital-societies/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">RSVP Now</a></p><h2>Programme&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong></h2><p><strong>9:00-9:15&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Welcome and Introduction by Anita Prakash (Senior Policy Advisor ERIA)</p><p><strong>9:15-9:30&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Flavia Jurje Trifa on Labour Mobility, Education and Training.</p><p><strong>9:30-9:45&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Emmanuel C. Lallana on Inclusive Digital Societies</p><p><strong>9:45-10:00&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Irma Mosquera Valderrama An ASEM Model of Cooperation in Digital Economy Taxation</p><p><strong>10:00-10:15&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Lurong Chen on Asia and Europe: Cooperation in Digital Connectivity</p><p><strong>10:15-10:45&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Roundtable Q&amp;A moderated by Anita Prakash</p><p><strong>10:45-11:00&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</strong>Closing words Irma Mosquera, Lily Sprangers and Anita Prakash</p><h2>Short Bio of Speakers and Moderator</h2><p><strong>Irma Mosquera Valderrama, PhD&nbsp;</strong>is Full Professor Tax Governance and PhD Dean at Leiden Law School (Leiden University), the Netherlands. She is also the EU&nbsp;<a href="https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universiteitleiden.nl%2Fen%2Fdossiers%2Ferasmusplus%2Fjean-monnet&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cn.f.boekkooi%40law.leidenuniv.nl%7C77fa1294a1014d7d92e808da962f9a2f%7Cca2a7f76dbd74ec091086b3d524fb7c8%7C0%7C0%7C637987428431438340%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=Ls%2FtAiEru1bsrE3ym4JjTAetyinU2lVOkdmogC4VUQY%3D&amp;reserved=0">Jean Monnet&nbsp;</a>Chair Holder on the topic of EU Tax Governance (<a href="https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universiteitleiden.nl%2Fen%2Flaw%2Finstitute-for-tax-law-and-economics%2Ftax-law%2Feu-tax-governance&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cn.f.boekkooi%40law.leidenuniv.nl%7C77fa1294a1014d7d92e808da962f9a2f%7Cca2a7f76dbd74ec091086b3d524fb7c8%7C0%7C0%7C637987428431438340%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=OutZ3%2Fdsj%2BpPQe6bY7r1DRFkBGm%2FyYrCWGZeUb7892M%3D&amp;reserved=0">EUTAXGOV</a>), and Lead Researcher of the&nbsp;<a href="https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcordis.europa.eu%2Fproject%2Frcn%2F213400%2Fen&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cn.f.boekkooi%40law.leidenuniv.nl%7C77fa1294a1014d7d92e808da962f9a2f%7Cca2a7f76dbd74ec091086b3d524fb7c8%7C0%7C0%7C637987428431438340%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=IXnbomVF1k800dFaFSHY%2BLT31KhN5QVHVU5Mlq%2FBxaY%3D&amp;reserved=0">European Research Council</a>&nbsp;(ERC) Funded Project that investigates Global Tax Governance (<a href="https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fglobtaxgov.weblog.leidenuniv.nl%2F&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cn.f.boekkooi%40law.leidenuniv.nl%7C77fa1294a1014d7d92e808da962f9a2f%7Cca2a7f76dbd74ec091086b3d524fb7c8%7C0%7C0%7C637987428431594557%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=vd%2F2FOtooIgUJeNrl%2F1wDKypqdFNyJSNC4Ff0hfaqBc%3D&amp;reserved=0">GLOBTAXGOV</a>).&nbsp;Her areas of expertise are international tax law and comparative tax law in developed and developing countries and more recently exchange of information and BEPS-related issues in developing countries.</p><p><strong>Flavia Jurje Trifa PhD</strong>, is the Head of Policy and Government Affairs at the digital consultancy firm ZIMT Labs. Previously, she worked as a senior researcher and lecturer at the University of Geneva/Global Studies Institute and at the University of Lucerne, and was a visiting fellow at the London School of Economics and Political Science. Her main research focus is on global trade regulations and&nbsp;migration, the role of business in international migration governance, and labour mobility in regional integration frameworks. For the 13th Asia-Europe Meeting (ASEM), she wrote about Asia-Europe cooperation on labour mobility, education and training.</p><p><strong>Emmanuel C. Lallana,&nbsp;PhD</strong> is the Chief Executive of Ideacorp &ndash; an independent, non-profit organization in the Philippines. He works on ICT for development (ICT4D) issues, particularly ICT Policy Development, ICT in Education and e-Governance. He has published on ICT4D issues and trains government officials from developing countries on ICT policy development, eGovernance and Social Media for Development. For the 13th&nbsp;ASEM, he wrote on building inclusive digital societies.</p><p><strong>Lurong Chen, PhD</strong>&nbsp;is Senior Economist at ERIA.<strong>&nbsp;</strong>His research interests include digital economy, Asian regionalism, global value chains, trade in services, and IPRs. He is also working on FTAs, Chinese economy, and RCEP negotiation. Before joining ERIA, Dr Chen was a Research Fellow at the United Nations University.</p><p><strong>Moderator:&nbsp;</strong><strong>Anita Prakash&nbsp;</strong>is a Senior Policy Advisor in the Office of the President of the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), Jakarta, Indonesia. She provides policy and research support for bilateral and multilateral processes between ASEAN and its Dialogue Partners, the Trade Ministers meetings in ASEAN, the East Asia Summit, the Asia-Europe Meeting, and the G20. Her policy research covers international trade and investment with a focus on GVCs and supply chains, and connectivity plans in Southeast Asia, East Asia, and between Asia-Europe and Asia-Africa. Her current research focus is on emerging economic architecture and supply chains in the Indo-Pacific.</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:15:"Ms Kemala Putri";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:38:"ERIA, the LeidenAsiaCentre, GLOBTAXGOV";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-07";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:9671:"Asia-Europe Cooperation on Inclusive Digital Societies Asia-Europe Cooperation on Inclusive Digital Societies On 7 December 2022, the LeidenAsiaCentre together with GLOBTAXGOV and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), organises a webinar on Asian-European cooperation in the digital sphere. The webinar will specifically focus on the building of inclusive digital societies. This means that individuals, particularly those in disadvantaged groups, have access to, and the skills to use ICT and are therefore able to participate in and benefit from the emergent digital society. In which ways can Asia and Europe cooperate in creating inclusive digital societies? What forms of cooperation between Asian and European countries already exist in the digital sphere?
This webinar follows the 13th&nbsp;Asia-Europe Meeting (ASEM) Summit, and the book 'Multilateral Cooperation for a Resilient, Sustainable, and Rules-Based Future for ASEM', which was a result of that summit.
Date:&nbsp;Wednesday, 7 December 2022Time: 9 AM - 11 AM&nbsp; Central European Time (CET) / 3 PM to 5 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)
RSVP Now
Programme&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
9:00-9:15&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Welcome and Introduction by Anita Prakash (Senior Policy Advisor ERIA)
9:15-9:30&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Flavia Jurje Trifa on Labour Mobility, Education and Training.
9:30-9:45&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Emmanuel C. Lallana on Inclusive Digital Societies
9:45-10:00&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Irma Mosquera Valderrama An ASEM Model of Cooperation in Digital Economy Taxation
10:00-10:15&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Lurong Chen on Asia and Europe: Cooperation in Digital Connectivity
10:15-10:45&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Roundtable Q&amp;A moderated by Anita Prakash
10:45-11:00&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;Closing words Irma Mosquera, Lily Sprangers and Anita Prakash
Short Bio of Speakers and Moderator
Irma Mosquera Valderrama, PhD&nbsp;is Full Professor Tax Governance and PhD Dean at Leiden Law School (Leiden University), the Netherlands. She is also the EU&nbsp;Jean Monnet&nbsp;Chair Holder on the topic of EU Tax Governance (EUTAXGOV), and Lead Researcher of the&nbsp;European Research Council&nbsp;(ERC) Funded Project that investigates Global Tax Governance (GLOBTAXGOV).&nbsp;Her areas of expertise are international tax law and comparative tax law in developed and developing countries and more recently exchange of information and BEPS-related issues in developing countries.
Flavia Jurje Trifa PhD, is the Head of Policy and Government Affairs at the digital consultancy firm ZIMT Labs. Previously, she worked as a senior researcher and lecturer at the University of Geneva/Global Studies Institute and at the University of Lucerne, and was a visiting fellow at the London School of Economics and Political Science. Her main research focus is on global trade regulations and&nbsp;migration, the role of business in international migration governance, and labour mobility in regional integration frameworks. For the 13th Asia-Europe Meeting (ASEM), she wrote about Asia-Europe cooperation on labour mobility, education and training.
Emmanuel C. Lallana,&nbsp;PhD is the Chief Executive of Ideacorp &ndash; an independent, non-profit organization in the Philippines. He works on ICT for development (ICT4D) issues, particularly ICT Policy Development, ICT in Education and e-Governance. He has published on ICT4D issues and trains government officials from developing countries on ICT policy development, eGovernance and Social Media for Development. For the 13th&nbsp;ASEM, he wrote on building inclusive digital societies.
Lurong Chen, PhD&nbsp;is Senior Economist at ERIA.&nbsp;His research interests include digital economy, Asian regionalism, global value chains, trade in services, and IPRs. He is also working on FTAs, Chinese economy, and RCEP negotiation. Before joining ERIA, Dr Chen was a Research Fellow at the United Nations University.
Moderator:&nbsp;Anita Prakash&nbsp;is a Senior Policy Advisor in the Office of the President of the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), Jakarta, Indonesia. She provides policy and research support for bilateral and multilateral processes between ASEAN and its Dialogue Partners, the Trade Ministers meetings in ASEAN, the East Asia Summit, the Asia-Europe Meeting, and the G20. Her policy research covers international trade and investment with a focus on GVCs and supply chains, and connectivity plans in Southeast Asia, East Asia, and between Asia-Europe and Asia-Africa. Her current research focus is on emerging economic architecture and supply chains in the Indo-Pacific. <html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p>The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) - the world&rsquo;s largest trade deal - came into effect in early 2022. For Lao PDR, RCEP will create favourable trade, investment, and tourism conditions<strong>.&nbsp;</strong>To increase awareness of the agreement and the opportunities created by it, ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme, in collaboration with the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC),&nbsp;brings the socialisation of RCEP chapters, benefits and opportunities to the regional level in northern and southern provinces of Laos.</p>
<p>The regional workshop will focus on a session on the overall provision of RCEP, sessions<br /> dedicated to explain RCEP chapter related to the specific characteristic of the host city, followed by panel discussion from government and business sector.</p>
<ol>
<li>Overview and explanation RCEP Agreement.</li>
<li>Potential benefits of the specific chapter related to characteristic of the host city (i.e: in LuangPrabang the workshop will explore RCEP Chapter on Trade in Service and Investment whilethe Savannakhet workshop will explore RCEP Chapter on Trade in Goods).</li>
<li>Exchange discussion between government and business sector on the implementation<br /> process, opportunities and challenges of RCEP.</li>
</ol>
<h2>Event Details</h2>
<p><strong>1. Luang Prabang Workshop (online registration available)</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Date : Thursday, 8 December 2022&nbsp;</li>
<li>Time : 08.30 AM - 4.15 PM (Lao time, UTC+7)</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>2. Savannakhet Workshop (on-site only)</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Date : Tuesday, 13 December 2022</li>
<li>Time : 08.30 &ndash; 4.15&nbsp;(Lao time, UTC+7)</li>
</ul>
<h6><a class="bluebtn" href="https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZYod-upqjwqG9D2xMYIcI2NHzh14z961V5O" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><br />REGISTER HERE</a></h6>

<p><input id="ext" type="hidden" /><input id="ext" type="hidden" /><input id="ext" type="hidden" /></p>
</body>
</html>";s:10:"image_name";s:37:"/uploads/events/logo63c12007aa684.png";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:36:"Luang Prabang & Savannakhet, Lao PDR";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-08";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2022-12-13";s:8:"keywords";s:12445:"Dissemination on RCEP Agreement for Lao PDR Dissemination on RCEP Agreement for Lao PDR The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) - the world&rsquo;s largest trade deal - came into effect in early 2022. For Lao PDR, RCEP will create favourable trade, investment, and tourism conditions.&nbsp;To increase awareness of the agreement and the opportunities created by it, ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme, in collaboration with the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC),&nbsp;brings the socialisation of RCEP chapters, benefits and opportunities to the regional level in northern and southern provinces of Laos.
The regional workshop will focus on a session on the overall provision of RCEP, sessions dedicated to explain RCEP chapter related to the specific characteristic of the host city, followed by panel discussion from government and business sector.

Overview and explanation RCEP Agreement.
Potential benefits of the specific chapter related to characteristic of the host city (i.e: in LuangPrabang the workshop will explore RCEP Chapter on Trade in Service and Investment whilethe Savannakhet workshop will explore RCEP Chapter on Trade in Goods).
Exchange discussion between government and business sector on the implementation process, opportunities and challenges of RCEP.

Event Details
1. Luang Prabang Workshop (online registration available)

Date : Thursday, 8 December 2022&nbsp;
Time : 08.30 AM - 4.15 PM (Lao time, UTC+7)

2. Savannakhet Workshop (on-site only)

Date : Tuesday, 13 December 2022
Time : 08.30 &ndash; 4.15&nbsp;(Lao time, UTC+7)

Agenda
Thursday, 8 December 2022



8:30AM - 9AM&nbsp;

Opening Remarks

Head of Provincial Administration Office (TBC)
Mr Saysana Sayakone, Director General of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce
Mr Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA

Moderator: MOIC



9AM - 9:45AM

Overview of the RCEP Agreement

Ms&nbsp;Vilayphone Xindavong, Deputy Director General, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

Q&amp;A



9:45AM - 10AM

Break



10AM - 11AM

Trade in Services Chapter under RCEP

Mr Nongchith Khambounheuang, Director, Department of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

Q&amp;A



11AM - 12PM

Investment Chapter under RCEP

Ms&nbsp;Thidavanh Chongchith, Department of Investment Promotion, Ministry of Planning and Investment

Q&amp;A



12PM - 1.30PM

Lunch



1:30 - 2:45PM

Panel Discussion
How could businesses in Luang Prabang benefit from Trade in Services and Investment provisions under RCEP Agreement? What are possible challenges and opportunities that could be identified?

Mr Nongchith Khambounheuang, Director, Department of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce
Ms Thidavanh Chongchith, Department of Investment Promotion, Ministry of Planning and Investment
Representatives from Tourism association in Luang Prabang (TBC)
Representatives from Division of Industry and Commerce of LPB Province (TBC)

Q&amp;A
Moderated by Dr Pakaiphone Syphoxy



2:45PM - 3PM

Break



3PM - 4PM

Panel Discussion 
How to strengthen coordination mechanism between public and private sectors on decision-making and policy development processes? 

Representatives from Division of Industry and Commerce of LPB Province (TBC)
Representatives from LPB Chamber of Commerce and Industry (TBC)
Representative from Tourism Association in LPB (TBC)

Q&amp;A
Moderated by Representative from DFTP


4PM - 4:15PM

Closing Remarks 

Head of Provincial Administration Office (TBC)
Mr Saysana Sayakone, Director General of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

Overview of the RCEP Agreement

Trade in Goods and Rules of Origin under RCEP

Somphone Phady, Director, Department of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

Q&amp;A

Mr Somphone Phady, Director, Department of Foreign Trade Policy, Ministry of Industry and Commerce
Mr Phoxai Inthaboualy, Deputy Director, Department of Import and Export, Ministry of Industry and Commerce

Representatives from Import-Export businesses in Savannakhet (TBC)

Q&amp;A
Moderated by Dr Pakaiphone Syphoxy


&nbsp;2:45PM - 3PM

Break



&nbsp;3PM - 4PM

Panel Discussion
How to strengthen coordination mechanism between public and private sectors on decision-making and policy development processes?

Mr Saysana Sayakone, Director General of Foreign Trade Policy,

 gro.aire@anidiluam.anil anidiluaM aniL sM tnevE dirbyH         2202 opxE hceT aidobmaC  2202 opxE hceT aidobmaC";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-11-01 10:01:02";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-11-01 10:01:02";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:27;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7180";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:129:"special-t20-event-on-the-side-lines-of-the-g20-leaders-summit-shaping-digital-innovations-for-a-sustainable-and-stronger-recovery";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:138:"Special T20 Event on the Side-lines of the G20 Leaderâ€™s Summit: Shaping Digital Innovations for A Sustainable and Stronger Recovery";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-11-15";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:6967:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Evenbrite_bali_2.png" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p>COVID-19 has illustrated the power of digital innovations, in improving the individual and collective capabilities to drive change and be resilient in times of multiple combined crises. With an estimated 15% contribution to world GDP in 2015-2020, digital economy has been supporting global economic recovery. Thus, Indonesia&rsquo;s G20 Presidency placed digital transformation as one of its priority agendas for global recovery and is working towards a new global digital architecture that an strengthen digital connectivity, entrepreneurship, skills upgradations, and data flow.<br /> <br />In support of the G20 digital working group, T20 -Task Force 2 acted as a platform for exchanging information and experiences related to best practices in the field of Meaningful Digital Connectivity, Cyber Security, Empowerment.<br /> <br />Adoption and use of digital technologies and the speed transformation varies among G20 economies by demographic categories, industries, and firm size, raising concerns about the inclusiveness of the digital transformation. Barriers typically include some combination of a lack of high-quality and affordable infrastructure connectivity; a lack of trust in digital technologies and activities; a shortage of the skills needed to succeed in the digital economy; a more reactive than proactive approach to the openness of the Internet; services trade barriers; high costs and poor access to financing for smaller firms; barriers to the reallocation of resources across firms and sectors; and a lack of interoperability of standards. The growing number of digital agendas or strategies established by developed and emerging economies shows the relevance of a whole-of-government approach to address these issues in a coherent manner.</p><p>Based on the results of an open discussion at the T20 Indonesia several bold ideas were proposed to resolve these issues in the form of articulation digitalization for quality of life. G20 leaders could support the adoption of best practices and policies that enable all relevant actors, including SMEs, Cities to work together more effectively to help foster an interoperable environment in support of sustainable and inclusive growth. Several solutions were proposed, including establishment of Regional Center for Digital Economy for Sustainable Growth and the formulation of the Smarter World Living Lab.</p><h2>Objectives</h2><p>The special G20 event &#039;Shaping Digital Innovations for A Sustainable Recovery&#039; will be organized by the Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB) and Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) intends to:</p><ol><li>Raise awareness on the transformative role of the digital economy in driving stronger global growth</li><li>Promote factors that contribute to a people-cantered and sustainable approach to digital transformation at the G20 level</li><li>Gather political, business, and social leaders&rsquo; views on the regional knowledge centre(s) and living labs in support of the digital economy and support of the G20 digital agenda</li></ol><h2>Event Details</h2><ul><li>Date:&nbsp;Tuesday, 15 November 2022</li><li>Time: 1.30 PM - 3.45 PM (Bali Time/UTC +8)</li></ul><h2>Agenda</h2><table style="width: 669.333px;"><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>1PM - 1:30PM&nbsp;</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Registration</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>1:30PM - 1:40PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Welcoming and Opening Remarks</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Mr Koji Hachiyama</strong>, Chief Operating Officer, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li><li><strong>Prof Ir Taufan Marhaendraja, M.Sc., Ph.D. </strong>Head of Science and Technology Development (LPII)</li></ul><p><em>MC:&nbsp;</em><em><strong>Ms Lydia Ruddy</strong>, Director of Communications and Special Advisor to the President on US-ASEAN Affairs, ERIA</em></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>1:40PM - 1:50PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Special Remarks</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Prof</strong>&nbsp;<strong>Dr (HC.)</strong> <strong>K.</strong> <strong>H.</strong> <strong>Ma&#039;ruf Amin</strong>, Vice President of Indonesia</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>1:50PM - 2:20PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Keynote Speeches</strong></p><ol><li><strong>Dr (H.C.)</strong> <strong>Ir</strong>&nbsp;<strong>Airlangga Hartarto, </strong><strong>M.B.A.</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>M.M.T.</strong><strong>, IPU</strong>, Minister of Coordinating for Economic Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia</li><li><strong>Prof Sachin Chaturvedi</strong>, Director General at the Research and Information System for Developing Countries (RIS) New Delhi</li></ol></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>2:20PM - 3:20PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>&lsquo;How can developing countries make the most of the digital revolution and what is the role of G20?&rsquo;</strong></p><p><strong>Moderator:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi</strong>, Director of Research Strategy and Innovation, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li></ul><p><strong>Panellists:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Prof Bambang Permadi Soemantri Brodjonegoro, S.E., M.U.P., Ph.D.</strong>, Lead Co-Chair Think 20, Former Minister of Research and Technology on &lsquo;How to gain the economic in the world through the smarter world living lab?&rsquo;</li><li><strong>Prof Dr Ir Suhono Harso Supangkat, M.Eng</strong>, Lead Co-Chair Task Force 2, Head of Smart City and Community Innovation Center, Bandung Institute of Technology on &lsquo;Establishment the smarter world living lab&rsquo;</li><li><strong>Prof Toshio Obi</strong>, Co-Chair of Task Force 2 - T20 Indonesia, Director, APEC Digital Government Research Center; Professor Emeritus, Waseda University on &lsquo;Economy digitalization to improve the quality of life&rsquo; <em>(online)</em></li><li><strong>Ms Cyn-Young Park, </strong>Director Economic Research and Regional Cooperation Department of Asian Development Bank <em>(online)</em></li><li><strong>Mr Rajan Natarajan</strong>, CEO of&nbsp; PT Business Intelligence technologies</li><li><strong>Mr Nicolas J.A.Buchoud</strong>, Advisor to the Dean and to the T7 Japan, ADBI, Tokyo and Fellow, Global Solutions Initiative (GSI, Berlin)<sup>*</sup></li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>3:20PM - 3:40PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Q&amp;A and Discussion</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 138px;"><p>3:40PM - 3:45PM</p></td><td style="width: 513.333px;"><p><strong>Closing Remarks</strong></p></td></tr></table><p>&nbsp;</p><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/F0-4Phd2QyQ" width="800" height="449" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:15:"Bali, Indonesia";s:5:"major";s:20:"Ms Abigail Batlhazar";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-11-15";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:11537:"Special T20 Event on the Side-lines of the G20 Leaderâ€™s Summit: Shaping Digital Innovations for A Sustainable and Stronger Recovery Special T20 Event on the Side-lines of the G20 Leaderâ€™s Summit: Shaping Digital Innovations for A Sustainable and Stronger Recovery COVID-19 has illustrated the power of digital innovations, in improving the individual and collective capabilities to drive change and be resilient in times of multiple combined crises. With an estimated 15% contribution to world GDP in 2015-2020, digital economy has been supporting global economic recovery. Thus, Indonesia&rsquo;s G20 Presidency placed digital transformation as one of its priority agendas for global recovery and is working towards a new global digital architecture that an strengthen digital connectivity, entrepreneurship, skills upgradations, and data flow. In support of the G20 digital working group, T20 -Task Force 2 acted as a platform for exchanging information and experiences related to best practices in the field of Meaningful Digital Connectivity, Cyber Security, Empowerment. Adoption and use of digital technologies and the speed transformation varies among G20 economies by demographic categories, industries, and firm size, raising concerns about the inclusiveness of the digital transformation. Barriers typically include some combination of a lack of high-quality and affordable infrastructure connectivity; a lack of trust in digital technologies and activities; a shortage of the skills needed to succeed in the digital economy; a more reactive than proactive approach to the openness of the Internet; services trade barriers; high costs and poor access to financing for smaller firms; barriers to the reallocation of resources across firms and sectors; and a lack of interoperability of standards. The growing number of digital agendas or strategies established by developed and emerging economies shows the relevance of a whole-of-government approach to address these issues in a coherent manner.
Based on the results of an open discussion at the T20 Indonesia several bold ideas were proposed to resolve these issues in the form of articulation digitalization for quality of life. G20 leaders could support the adoption of best practices and policies that enable all relevant actors, including SMEs, Cities to work together more effectively to help foster an interoperable environment in support of sustainable and inclusive growth. Several solutions were proposed, including establishment of Regional Center for Digital Economy for Sustainable Growth and the formulation of the Smarter World Living Lab.
Objectives
The special G20 event 'Shaping Digital Innovations for A Sustainable Recovery' will be organized by the Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB) and Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) intends to:

Raise awareness on the transformative role of the digital economy in driving stronger global growth
Promote factors that contribute to a people-cantered and sustainable approach to digital transformation at the G20 level
Gather political, business, and social leaders&rsquo; views on the regional knowledge centre(s) and living labs in support of the digital economy and support of the G20 digital agenda

Event Details

Date:&nbsp;Tuesday, 15 November 2022
Time: 1.30 PM - 3.45 PM (Bali Time/UTC +8)

Agenda

2:20PM - 3:20PM


&lsquo;How can developing countries make the most of the digital revolution and what is the role of G20?&rsquo;
Moderator:

Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Director of Research Strategy and Innovation, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)

Panellists:

19:29:11";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:26:"abigail.balthazar@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:28;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7179";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:72:"eria-adb-aws-webinar-accelerating-digital-health-outcomes-with-the-cloud";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:73:"ERIA-ADB-AWS Webinar: Accelerating Digital Health Outcomes with the Cloud";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-11-22";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:3774:"<p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/adbawseria.png" alt="" width="800" height="450" /></p><p>Over the past decade, cloud computing has revolutionized how people and organizations work around the world by democratizing access to technology, affording organizations of all sizes with access to a plethora of digital tools, as well as the security and sustainability benefits of the cloud. Cloud computing is the foundational enabler of the digital transformation of governments, businesses and organizations of all sizes; the default pathway for innovation.</p><p>Today, governments, public sector organizations, not-for-profits, universities, small and medium enterprises, and enterprises of all sizes across Asia innovate better, faster, and more cost-efficiently through the cloud. Yet, many organizations, both in the public and private sector, have a rudimentary understanding of the cloud and the policies that can enable cloud adoption across different sectors.</p><p><strong>Asian Development Bank (ADB), the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are hosting a series of Policy Webinars centered around the theme of &ldquo;Digital Transformation with the Cloud&rdquo;. </strong>This Policy Webinar series is a multi-stakeholder dialogue that will bring together policymakers, regulators, think tanks, academia, industry, and other key stakeholders to explore how the cloud and forward-thinking, pro-innovation digital policies can accelerate the digital transformation journey of nations. It will focus on enhancing our collective understanding about the cloud, its benefits, and the policy best practices for digital transformation through the cloud. The webinars will run fort-monthly over 2022/2023.</p><p>The upcoming webinar will be a deep-dive into the healthcare sector and how the use of cloud can accelerate digital health outcomes. There will be a presentation of a study done by Deloitte on the benefits of cloud enabled healthcare in the ASEAN region, followed by a panel discussion. Details can be found below.</p><h2>Event Details</h2><ul><li>Date:&nbsp;Tuesday, 22 November &nbsp;2022</li><li>Time: 10 AM - 11.30 AM (Singapore Time/UTC +8)</li></ul><h2>Agenda</h2><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 142.562px;"><p>10AM - 10:20AM</p></td><td style="width: 451.438px;"><p><strong>Report on Economic Benefits of Cloud-Enabled Healthcare</strong></p><ul><li>Nick Hull, &nbsp;Associate Director, Deloitte Access Economics</li></ul></td></tr></table><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 141.562px;"><p>10:20AM - 11:30AM</p></td><td style="width: 452.438px;"><p><strong>Panel discussion: Accelerating Digital Health outcomes with the Cloud</strong></p><p>The panel will explore the potential for digital health in the region, how to increase cloud adoption in the healthcare sector (including policy enablers and best practices for digital health), and how digital health can help improve health equity in the region.</p><p>Panelists:</p><ul><li>Sruthi Srikanthan, Partner, Deloitte Access Economics (Moderator)</li><li>Andrew Wiltshire, Healthcare Policy Lead, Asia Pacific &amp; Japan, AWS</li><li>Dr Antonio Villanueva, Senior Advisor on Healthcare Policy, ERIA</li><li>Eduardo Banzon, MD, Msc Principal Health Specialist, ADB &amp; Honorary Visiting Associate Professor, National University of Singapore</li><li>Setiaji Setiaji, Chief of Digital Transformation Office, Ministry of Health, Indonesia</li><li>Simeen Mirza, Senior Strategy Consultant, Access Health International</li></ul></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://adb-org.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_oqlgTFiKQS-o7TJFrnEn7g" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Register Now!</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Amelia Litania";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-11-22";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:6807:"ERIA-ADB-AWS Webinar: Accelerating Digital Health Outcomes with the Cloud ERIA-ADB-AWS Webinar: Accelerating Digital Health Outcomes with the Cloud Over the past decade, cloud computing has revolutionized how people and organizations work around the world by democratizing access to technology, affording organizations of all sizes with access to a plethora of digital tools, as well as the security and sustainability benefits of the cloud. Cloud computing is the foundational enabler of the digital transformation of governments, businesses and organizations of all sizes; the default pathway for innovation.
Today, governments, public sector organizations, not-for-profits, universities, small and medium enterprises, and enterprises of all sizes across Asia innovate better, faster, and more cost-efficiently through the cloud. Yet, many organizations, both in the public and private sector, have a rudimentary understanding of the cloud and the policies that can enable cloud adoption across different sectors.
Asian Development Bank (ADB), the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are hosting a series of Policy Webinars centered around the theme of &ldquo;Digital Transformation with the Cloud&rdquo;. This Policy Webinar series is a multi-stakeholder dialogue that will bring together policymakers, regulators, think tanks, academia, industry, and other key stakeholders to explore how the cloud and forward-thinking, pro-innovation digital policies can accelerate the digital transformation journey of nations. It will focus on enhancing our collective understanding about the cloud, its benefits, and the policy best practices for digital transformation through the cloud. The webinars will run fort-monthly over 2022/2023.
The upcoming webinar will be a deep-dive into the healthcare sector and how the use of cloud can accelerate digital health outcomes. There will be a presentation of a study done by Deloitte on the benefits of cloud enabled healthcare in the ASEAN region, followed by a panel discussion. Details can be found below.
Event Details

Date:&nbsp;Tuesday, 22 November &nbsp;2022
Time: 10 AM - 11.30 AM (Singapore Time/UTC +8)

Agenda




10AM - 10:20AM


Report on Economic Benefits of Cloud-Enabled Healthcare

Nick Hull, &nbsp;Associate Director, Deloitte Access Economics









10:20AM - 11:30AM


Panel discussion: Accelerating Digital Health outcomes with the Cloud
The panel will explore the potential for digital health in the region, how to increase cloud adoption in the healthcare sector (including policy enablers and best practices for digital health), and how digital health can help improve health equity in the region.
Panelists:

Sruthi Srikanthan, Partner, Deloitte Access Economics (Moderator)
Andrew Wiltshire, Healthcare Policy Lead, Asia Pacific &amp; Japan, AWS
Dr Antonio Villanueva, Senior Advisor on Healthcare Policy, ERIA
Eduardo Banzon, MD, Msc Principal Health Specialist, ADB &amp; Honorary Visiting Associate Professor, National University of Singapore
Setiaji Setiaji, Chief of Digital Transformation Office, Ministry of Health, Indonesia
Simeen Mirza, Senior Strategy Consultant, Access Health International

rebmevoN 42 42-11-2202  42-11-2202   gro.aire@inayadnah inayadnaH sM tnevE dirbyH        2202YF ni gniteeM )NIR( krowteN setutitsnI hcraeseR 2202YF ni gniteeM )NIR( krowteN setutitsnI hcraeseR";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-10-27 15:21:08";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-10-27 15:21:08";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:18:"handayani@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:31;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7172";s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:170:"rcep-10-year-anniversary-reminiscing-the-journey-of-rcep-and-launching-of-eria-book-dynamism-of-east-asia-and-regional-comprehensive-economic-partnership-rcep-the-framewo";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:202:"RCEP 10-Year Anniversary: Reminiscing the Journey of RCEP and Launching of ERIA Book: Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-11-02";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:13017:"<h2><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/HLF%20on%20RCEP%20-%20Banner.png" alt="" width="800" height="433" /></h2><h2>Background</h2><p>The year 2022 highlights the importance of RCEP as the largest global regional and global trading block. RCEP as a &lsquo;rule-based&rsquo; multilateral regional free trade agreement will be important for regional and global pandemic recovery. With the RCEP entering into force in early 2022, it has been 10 years since its inception, making it even more important to commemorate this momentous occasion. The forum combines two key events:</p><ol><li>The 10<sup>th</sup> Anniversary of RCEP initiation: To mark this momentous occasion, it is timely and necessary to indulge in the retrospection of RCEP&rsquo;s 10-year journey. The deliberation on the achievements and lessons learned from negotiating and signing of RCEP will culminate in the successful implementation of RCEP</li><li>The launching of ERIA&#039;s second book on RCEP titled &lsquo;Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration&rsquo;. The book examines and explores the key elements of the agreement as well as discusses the key potential implications of RCEP to the regional integration process.</li></ol><h2>Objectives</h2><p>This event aims to:</p><ul><li>Reminisce the decade-long journey of RCEP and highlight RCEP achievements and the lessons learned since its negotiation stage as well as explore priority areas to promote the utilization of RCEP;</li><li>Develop deeper understanding on the key elements of the agreement and highlighting the implications of the RCEP to domestic structural transformation and regional integration with the book launch;</li><li>Enhance the understanding of relevant stakeholders on the significance and opportunities from RCEP Agreement to facilitate greater trade and investment in the region.</li></ul><h2>Event Details</h2><ul><li>Date: Wednesday, 2 November&nbsp; - Thursday, 3 November 2022</li><li>Venue: Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra</li></ul><h2>Agenda</h2><p><strong>DAY 1 : 2&nbsp;NOVEMBER 2022</strong></p><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 143.887px;"><p>8:00AM - 8:30AM</p></td><td style="width: 451.113px;"><p><strong>Welcome Remarks</strong></p><ul><li><strong>H.E. Mr PAN Sorasak</strong>, Chair of the 54<sup>th</sup> ASEAN Economic Ministers (AEM) Meeting; Minister of Commerce of the Kingdom of Cambodia</li></ul><p><strong>Keynote Address&nbsp;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Samdech Akka Moha Sena Padei Techo HUN Sen</strong>,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Cambodia</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 143.887px;"><p>8:30AM - 8:40AM</p></td><td style="width: 451.113px;"><p><strong>Handover Ceremony of ERIA Second RCEP Book and other ERIA Studies</strong></p><p>&#039;Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration&#039;</p></td></tr></table><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 144.575px;"><p>8:40AM - 9:10AM</p></td><td style="width: 451.425px;"><p><strong>Coffee Break</strong></p></td></tr></table><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 143.575px;"><p>9:10AM - 9:20AM</p></td><td style="width: 452.425px;"><p><strong>Opening Remarks</strong></p><p><strong>Prof Hidetoshi Nishimura</strong>, President of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</p></td></tr></table><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 142.575px;"><p>9:20AM - 10:30AM</p></td><td style="width: 453.425px;"><p><strong>High-level Panel Discussion on the Genesis of RCEP</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p>This session will look back on the stories and journey behind RCEP from the perspective of key officials and stakeholders who were involved in developing and/or negotiation of RCEP. Highlights of discussion could include issues such as</p><ul><li>the origin of RCEP,</li><li>challenges during the course of RCEP negotiations,</li><li>opportunities for businesses (including SMEs) and key stakeholders, and</li><li>way forward for RCEP in strengthening regional trade architecture (AEC) and multilateral trading</li></ul><p>Moderator:</p><ul><li><strong>Ms Anna Robeniol</strong>, Advisor to the Secretary-General of ASEAN; Advisor to the Deputy Secretary-General of ASEAN for ASEAN Economic Community</li></ul><p><strong>Panelists:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>H.E. The year 2022 highlights the importance of RCEP as the largest global regional and global trading block. RCEP as a &lsquo;rule-based&rsquo; multilateral regional free trade agreement will be important for regional and global pandemic recovery. With the RCEP entering into force in early 2022, it has been 10 years since its inception, making it even more important to commemorate this momentous occasion. The forum combines two key events:

The 10th Anniversary of RCEP initiation: To mark this momentous occasion, it is timely and necessary to indulge in the retrospection of RCEP&rsquo;s 10-year journey. The deliberation on the achievements and lessons learned from negotiating and signing of RCEP will culminate in the successful implementation of RCEP
The launching of ERIA's second book on RCEP titled &lsquo;Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration&rsquo;. The book examines and explores the key elements of the agreement as well as discusses the key potential implications of RCEP to the regional integration process.

Objectives
This event aims to:

Reminisce the decade-long journey of RCEP and highlight RCEP achievements and the lessons learned since its negotiation stage as well as explore priority areas to promote the utilization of RCEP;
Develop deeper understanding on the key elements of the agreement and highlighting the implications of the RCEP to domestic structural transformation and regional integration with the book launch;
Enhance the understanding of relevant stakeholders on the significance and opportunities from RCEP Agreement to facilitate greater trade and investment in the region.

Event Details

Date: Wednesday, 2 November&nbsp; - Thursday, 3 November 2022
Venue: Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra

Agenda
DAY 1 : 2&nbsp;NOVEMBER 2022




8:00AM - 8:30AM


Welcome Remarks

H.E. Mr PAN Sorasak, Chair of the 54th ASEAN Economic Ministers (AEM) Meeting; Minister of Commerce of the Kingdom of Cambodia

Keynote Address&nbsp;

Samdech Akka Moha Sena Padei Techo HUN Sen,&nbsp;Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Cambodia





8:30AM - 8:40AM


Handover Ceremony of ERIA Second RCEP Book and other ERIA Studies
'Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration'








8:40AM - 9:10AM


Coffee Break








9:10AM - 9:20AM


Opening Remarks
Prof Hidetoshi Nishimura, President of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)








9:20AM - 10:30AM


High-level Panel Discussion on the Genesis of RCEP&nbsp;
This session will look back on the stories and journey behind RCEP from the perspective of key officials and stakeholders who were involved in developing and/or negotiation of RCEP. Highlights of discussion could include issues such as

the origin of RCEP,
challenges during the course of RCEP negotiations,
opportunities for businesses (including SMEs) and key stakeholders, and
way forward for RCEP in strengthening regional trade architecture (AEC) and multilateral trading

Moderator:

Ms Anna Robeniol, Advisor to the Secretary-General of ASEAN; Advisor to the Deputy Secretary-General of ASEAN for ASEAN Economic Community

Panelists:

H.E. Dato Lim Jock Hoi,&nbsp;Secretary-General of ASEAN



H.E.&nbsp;Professor Mari Elka Pangestu,&nbsp;Managing Director of Development Policy and Partnerships, World Bank; Former Minister of Trade (2004-2011), Republic of Indonesia; Former Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy (2011-2014), Republic of Indonesia (online)


Mr Iman Pambagyo,&nbsp;Former Chair of RCEP Trade Negotiating Committee (TNC); Former Director General of International Trade Negotiation, Ministry of Trade, Republic of Indonesia


H.E. Mr Han-Koo Yeo,&nbsp;Former Lead of ROK RCEP Trade Negotiating Committee (TNC); Former Minister for Trade (2021-2022), Republic of Korea










10:30AM - 11:30AM


Future of RCEP: Lessons learned from the 10 years of RCEP Journey
Reflecting from the lessons learned of RCEP&rsquo;s decade-long journey, this part will feature a session with stakeholders to unpack findings from recent studies/analysis on RCEP and its potential ahead.
Moderator:

Dr Julia Puspadewi Tijaja,&nbsp;Head of Market and Competitiveness, Prospera

Panelists:

Prof Shujiro Urata,&nbsp;Advisor to ERIA President, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
Dr Sanchita Basu-Das,&nbsp;Economist, Asian Development BankPresident of the Cambodia Chamber of Commerce, Chair of the East Asia Business Summit
Mr Neak Oknha Kith Meng, President of the Cambodia Chamber of Commerce, Chair of the East Asia Business Summit
H.E. Mr Satvinder Singh,&nbsp;Deputy Secretary-General of ASEAN for ASEAN Economic Community









11:30AM - 11:40AM


Photo Session (High-level Panelist + Minister H.E. Mr. PAN Sorasak)








11:40AM - 12:00PM


Launch of the ASEAN Tariff Finder
A platform to help businesses, particularly MSMEs to access information regarding tariffs in various FTAs.
Closing Remarks

H.E. Mr Satvinder Singh,&nbsp;Deputy Secretary-General of ASEAN for ASEAN Economic Community









12:00PM - 1:10PM


Lunch








Discussion on ERIA RCEP Book
Dynamism of East Asia and Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP): The Framework for Regional Integration

Issues in Investment Chapter
